div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1127 Phanagoria (near mod. Sennaia), Ta- man' Peninsula, Krasnodar Territory, RSFSR, 1948 Burial: late 2nd cent. B.C. (Golenko) Contents: 32 AE. Pot hoard with frags. of seal ring, buckles, casting molds, other bronze objects Panticapaeum: 24 AE (as BMC 17-18 [1], 20 [1], 28-29 and 32-33 [7; 1 of 32-33 ctmk. with tripod], 39 [1], 44-46 [10], 47 variant [1]; Zograph, pl. 42, 11 [1], pl. 43, 19 [1] Minns, pl. 5, 19 [1] Phanagoria: 4 AE (as BMC 2-3 [3]; Burach- kov, pl. 23, 22 [1]) Unc.: 4 AE Disposition: Moscow (Pushkin) Shelov, NE 3 (1962), pp. 57, 121-2 â€ Kharko, Soobshcheniia Gosudarstvennogo Muzeia izobrazitel'nykh iskusstv imeni A.S. Push- kina 4 (Leningrad, 1968), pp. 94-95
